intro: Convolvulus shumardianus, commonly known as Shumard's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual with trailing stems that produce showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple and pink. The plant belongs to the bindweed family (Convolvulaceae) and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and hairy stems. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in open woods. The flowers bloom in the early morning, giving the plant its common name.
